1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
There's something very wrong going on here. And you don't know what it is.

Surely it's not a normal thing for your little sister to shrink everyone following dinner so that you can all fit inside her dollhouse. You feel an odd sensation come over you as you shrink all the way down to one foot tall, with the rest of your family. Except Lucky, of course, who is more content to drink from the toilet bowl with no one big enough to supervise her.

But everyone just accepts the playtime like it's a normal thing in this household. Briana laughs as she makes herself slightly bigger than everyone else. There's something to her look as she commands the rest of you to play all sorts of games with her. Even your mom goes along with it.

And so, you just go with the flow, accepting your new life with a little sister that can apparently do magic...

~

The next day has you awaking to your mother shaking you at the foot of your bed in the dollhouse.

"Wake up, honey. It's Saturday. Do you want to come to the lab with me?"

Lab. For some reason that brings back a memory of flooded hallways and giant women. It's a ridiculous image though and you end up shaking it off.

"Uh...Sure."

"Briana, dear," your mom turns to Briana, two feet tall and passed out in the living room of the dollhouse. "How you kindly grow me and Joan up so that we can go to work?"

Briana mumbles something and turns over. Your mother frowns and looks almost worried for a moment before shaking it off.

"Briana," she tries again in a sweet voice. "Please, sweetie. I can't be late..."

With great reluctance, Briana opens a bloodshot eye to glare at the both of you. She sighs and sits up.

"Fine...Go outside."

~

You and your mother don't say a word to each other in the car ride to her job. You try to remember where that is...That's right. At the college. She works as a job assistant at the local university. You're both back to your normal sizes at this point, mom being 4'10 and you being 5'4.

You follow her past the security check in and you're given your own lab coat for safety. You have changed out of those Arabian clothes at this point, wearing something you found in Briana's dollhouse that seemed to fit you and grew with you when she returned you to normal size. You can't feel a bit overdressed with a designer outfit underneath a smock as you enter the lab.

It's about what you expected it to look like, with all sorts of colorful beakers running about the side of the room. Everything is white and pristine, as would be expected from your mother.

She locks the door behind you.

"Okay," she says. "It's safe now."

You blink a few times. "Safe? What do you mean, mom?"

"From Briana," she replies, turning her attention to the table where there's a golden liquid in a vial. "Goodness, it's getting so scary now that she has that power. I don't even have a say in my own house, it feels."

"Wait...Didn't she always have that power?"

"No, not until recently. Don't you remember, Joan? They developed when she was starting to enter puberty. And they're only going to get worse as time goes on. We need to do something to bring her under control. That's what I've been working on here."

You suddenly feel like you've entered a war for dominance of your own house between your mom and Briana. Your mother turns on the burners and grasps her head.

"Nothing feels right about this," she states. "I feel not like myself all the time. Don't you, Joan?"

"Yeah...I think I know what you mean."

"I think Briana is the cause of it. Perhaps it has something to do with her budding magic. And that's what I tried to accomplish with this mixture. Something to combat it. Her powers are limited to controlling sizes. But I fear what would happen if she ever expanded that control. No one would ever be able to tell her what to do. Or what's right from wrong. We can't have that, do you understand?"

"I do!" you put your hands up in defense as your mother nears hysterics. "And I get what you mean by not feeling like yourself. Does the name...Alice ring any bells?"

"Alice?" your mother thinks hard for a moment but then winces like she has a headache. "...I lost it."

You frown. Your mother is clearly struggling to remember something. Perhaps if you worked together, you could try and figure out what's going on to fight back against Briana. But she also mentioned working on her own solution, you were guessing in the form of the golden liquid on the burner.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
You tried thinking about the things that have been flowing in and out of your mind. The idea of being a boy, this Alice woman, whoever Janet is, but each time you feel like you are close to grasping even a part of the truth it goes away. You feel like you are trying to grab a handful of water in the ocean of your mind. You ball up your fist and slam it into a counter causing a lot of glass to shake and tingle. "I hate this so much! Everything feels wrong but I don't know what it is! It's all Briana's fault, or I think it is, but I don't even know that. And even if she knows anything she's being a stupid brat and will just screw with us for the hell of it. And there's nothing we can do about it!" You felt tears welling up in your eyes, you felt defeated, and the worst part was you didn't know what had defeated you.

But your mom wasn't ready to give up yet. "I know it's frustrating Joan baby, but I'm not giving up and I don't want you to either. We still have a chance to discover the truth, and I think I have the tool that will help us break through the barrier."

"And what tool is that?" You ask wiping away the tears ready to embrace any beacon of hope.

"This." Mom said showing off the golden liquid in the beaker on the burner. "In this beaker is something that will help us, at least I think it can. Because this my dear, is something that shouldn't exist."

"Shouldn't exist? But it's right there."

"My dear think scientifically. We live in a world where it's possible for Briana to shrink and grow things and people at will, but she's the only who can do such a thing, I believe Briana is if not the center of, at least adjacent to some sort of anomaly that caused a shift in the world. This is what caused our minds to be rattled unable to remember the truth of the world."

"That's a neat theory and all mom, but that doesn't explain what's with the yellow stuff and how it will help us."

Mom rolled her eyes and continued as though you hadn't interrupted, "In my investigation into the Briana anomaly I was looking for some sort of physical reason that could explain how she got her abilities. And I found...something that shouldn't exist."

"What was it? An alien artifact? An ancient medallion? A magic lamp?"

Mom shook her head, "No, nothing quite so obvious, I found something that in this reality, shouldn't exist. It's something that after testing it against everything I could possibly find I am convinced I found something from an alternate dimension, or possibly even another timeline."

"No freaking way. What was it you found?"

"It was something that after a lot of testing I determined could help us learn the truth, I broke some of it down and after a number of tests I believe my concoction is ready for human testing."

"I'll try it! I need to find out what's going on in my own head! What's going on with my life! Nothing about me, about Joan is what it should be."

Mom let out a tear of her own, "I know baby, one of us needs to test this and if you want it to be you, then you should drink it."

You nod your head as your mom took some tongs and removed the golden liquid filled beaker off it's burner to let it cool. As you waited for the liquid to stop boiling you asked, "So what exactly is this substance you found that shouldn't exist that I'm about to drink?"

Your mom looked up from her notes and told you what she found in your basement.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
"I managed to find some DNA," explained your mother. "From a person that doesn't exist."

"Doesn't exist?" you asked. "What do you mean?"

"We have enough equipment at the lab to tell the basics of DNA heritage. That's what I've been doing all this time. Running countless tests on this strand of DNA that I found in my room one day. It felt odd to me. Like something I've seen before but I haven't. And when I checked it over the course of a couple months, nothing matched it."

"Nothing matched it?"

"It belonged to a local family in our town, but when I ran some tests on them it matched none of them. If my theory is correct, then this is an article of clothing from a person in the alternate universe. And by mixing in a sample I acquired from Briana's magic, I think I've come to our solution to remembering things."

You looked at the golden mixture that smelled faintly of sunflowers. "So, what will it do?"

"With luck, it will open the door to our memories. I suspect it will...Alter your appearance in some fashion. But, in exchange, I'm hoping it will give you this mysterious person's memories. Then we could work on planning our next move."

That didn't sound very appealing to you, though it also sounded very familiar too. You looked at the vial in wonder. If it meant getting the missing half of your life back, you would do anything to fill that aching void in your mind.

"Well, bottoms up then, I guess."

You chug the vial like a water bottle as your mom stands by with her notepad.

Instantly, you doubled over as a sinking sensation filled your body. You felt small and your lab coat loose as you looked up at your mother. Being 5'4, she typically came up to your chin. It sent a chill down your spine to find that you were the one having to look up at her. If only slightly. Her being 4'10 and you standing at about 4'8 now.

"Fascinating," she muttered.

The changes didn't stop with shrinking though. You let out a slight burp as a strange feeling of fullness in your stomach that seemed to spread even to the tips of your fingers. That's when you began to grow outwards.

It felt like every breath your were taking caused the lab coat around your body to become ever so tighter. Every part of you was expanding with fat. Your face. Your gut. Your boobs. Especially your boobs. Everything you were wearing started to feel uncomfortably restricting. Buttons began to pop, exposing your growing cleavage. You were becoming as big as your mother, though still retaining your black hair.

You stumbled your way towards a mirror. The face that greeted you wasn't your own. It was another girl's, about your age. She had a slight nerd tinge to her, though was also oddly beautiful in her own way.

That's when the memories came back to you.

You were Alice Harper. Your parents were rich but never around much. You made for it by studying hard with the goals of becoming a scientist and changing the human body. Biology was your core subject of interest.

Then, you recalled everything that had happened over the course of this adventure. Or, at least the parts Alice was there for.

With Alice's powerful brain, you could put the missing pieces together of what happened. Alice had been in the kitchen, posing as your mother and the day going well enough. Then everything changed. Given you as John were a genie at the moment and Briana ended up with all her powers, you correctly guessed that Briana had stumbled upon the lamp and made wishes. That altered reality entirely.

"I know what happened," you said in a voice not your own.

Your mother looked up from her clipboard. "You do?"

"Kind of," you replied, rubbing your throbbing head. "But it's a long, complicated story. Too long didn't read, Briana altered reality using a genie's lamp."

"A genie's...What? That's ridiculous!"

"Ridiculous as being able to change people's sizes at will?" you asked. "What's worse is who we both once were no longer exist. But we also need to stop Briana before she realizes just how much power she has."

With your new brain power from Alice's body, you think for a minute.

The first idea that came to mind was to call for help with the Witch Wash number. You remembered seeing that on the laundry powder bottle and you, as John, had mentioned to Alice calling them once to fix things. But part of you dreaded admitting how badly you had messed this all up to them. With that thought, you remembered where the laundry powder bottle was in the house. Alice had hidden it away so Briana or Mini would never find it. Perhaps you could trick Briana into wearing different clothes and that would fizzle her size changing powers, then you could work on restoring your memories.

Alternatively, there was the genie outfit again. You remembered the test you had done as John with Alice observing it. One of you could slip into the outfit and imagine yourself as a genie, then you could get more wishes and fix all this. Though, being a freed genie from Briana's wishes, it would have to be Alice this time.

They probably deal with stuff like this all the time." You said digging for your cell phone as you typed in the numbers you somehow remembered as though it were your home phone.

"Fascinating! I wonder if I could send a request to have a look at some of their files,' the real Alice said actually licking your mom's lips in anticipation.

After the phone rang a few times your heart leapt for joy when you heard a familiar voice, "Hello. Thank you for calling Witch World Wide my name is Autumn how may I help you today?"

"Yes you really can help me. This may be hard to believe but my name is John Wallace."

"Ah yes John, it's good to hear from you again. How have you been enjoying our Witch Wash and size changing dress? Were you able to find any of your old clothes?"

"Well I promise you that we'll do what we can to help you out to the best of our abilities. Could you describe the problem you're having?"

With the knowledge freshly returned to your mind, you told Autumn everything that had happened since you had found your nearly non existent gym clothes, to accidentally turning yourself into a genie, to having your family and Alice's existence completely rewriten thanks to Briana's powers and wishes. As you finished the story you could here the every cheerful sounding Autumn sounding more concerned. "This is highly unfortunant. During testing of Witch Wash we had never had an experience like that. This is not...ideal. Wishes are normally very strictly regulated and the idea of a child making 3 of her own unsupervised is quite unfortunant. You should consider yourselves fortunant it wasn't worse than it turned out."

You were about to explode and complain about how you as John technically no longer existed, and then thought about what world shattering things Briana could have wished for and decided to look at the big picture and be thankful the wishes seemed to only effect your household and didn't end the world or something.

"Well Autumn, is there anything you can do to help?"

"Mr. Wallace, I do have a few standard procedures that could help, you'd be surprised how many people have had our products unfortunantly backfire through not following the instructions, although I admit yours is a more extreme case. After all unauthorized wishes are a very serious matter. That being said you have a number of options. You could always counter one wish with another. You could purchase a regulated and Witch World Wide approved custom Wish. The cost is steep, but most people tend to find that it is worth it."

"How much?" Being a high school student still you doubted you could afford an honest to goodness wish so Alice was probably going to have to bust open your mom's saving account you thought.

"If you choose that we'll get to what it would cost you, but there are other options. You could purchase a reality altering amulet. It sounds like most of the things effected by the wish your sister made could be corrected with this, you could rewrite reality back to the way it used to be or even make something different for yourself if you wished. This does not effect your body's to get them back to themselves, but you still have the Witch Wash product so that could help with that option. But be careful, you don't want that medallion to fall into the wrong hands."

"That one sounds like it could work, but that wouldn't take away Briana's powers."

"Are they really that big a concern? Well, if those powers are the biggest problem you have right now you could always go with the old standby the Body Swap Rings. They were the product that put Witch World Wide on the map. With them you could put yourself or anyone you trust into the body of your sister and that person would have the powers for themselves."

"Can you hold for a second while I talk consult my friend about this?"

"No problem Ms, I'm sorry. Mr. Wallace." You put the phone down and looked to Alice and asked, "So? What do you think?"

"I'd love to do all of them. So many options for experimentation and testing. We have a true scientific breakthrough just a delivery package away." You talked her down to only taking one of the options (for now) and picked up the phone again to tell Autumn your choice.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
You mull it over for a long time over the phone. Autumn is completely patient with you and Alice as you go back and forth, weighing your options.

"A wish would fix all of our problems," Alice offered.

"But the cost," you protest. "I don't know about you, but my family really doesn't have that kind of cash. Plus, it doesn't sound like it will be willy nilly wishes. They're going to pre-approve the wish, so it will be completely under their control."

"And body swap rings would be purposeless is getting our lives back to normal."

"So," you work with Alice's body's own brain power. "There's only one solution."

You pick up the phone and practically shout into the receiver. "We'll take the Reality Altering Necklace!"

"Splendid!" Autumn sounded completely chipper despite being put on hold for a good ten minutes. "Now then, we're looking at a low price of $500 with instant shipping."

You winced. Low price compared to your other solutions. But there went your savings for a new Xbox One. "Fine."

"We have your records right here including payment detail. Transferring funds right...Now! And you're all set, Mr. Wallace. Could you please supply your present location?"

"Present locations? You mean the lab...?" you looked to Alice who just shrugged. "Uh, 126 Pleasant Drive."

"Floor and room number, please?"

"What? I mean, floor one, lab 251."

"Sending the package now. Please confirm its delivery."

There was a flash out light out of the corner of your eye. Both you and Alice turned to find a brown cardboard box with the label for Witch World Wide logo on the front. Alice was the first to move, shuffling over to the box and opening it. In her chubby hand was a golden amulet.

"Uh, we got it."

"Excellent work, Mr. Wallace! Now, a couple of warnings before you begin altering reality. As I said, using this necklace will not make any physical changes for you or any other person. However, it will get your identities back in order. Also, do not put the necklace on until you're sure you're ready to use it. Given the intensity of your recent issues, I took the liberty of adding a fail safe. The necklace will only work for the first person who dons it. For everyone else, it would function only as a typical piece of jewelry."

Alice overheard the comment and dropped the necklace on the lab table immediately.

"Oh, wow. That's, uh, that's good thinking, Autumn. Thanks..."

"You're quite welcome, sir. Now, to use the necklace, you might notice three icons along its base. Each will alter a different thing about reality. Relationship. Identity. And time. Relationship will alter how you are viewed in relationship to others. You could make yourself not your little sister's brother, but her uncle for example. Identity has to do with your name and personal history. You could rewrite your childhood, for example. Lastly, the most dangerous one is time. You can effectively restart up to an entire week. Though this is limited to once a month and will drain the necklace's power for a time. To use any of these powers, simply clasp the proper edge of the necklace and say exactly how you want to change things very clearly. The necklace will do the rest, though expect some slight disorientation."

That all sounded pretty nice. If you thought back, the time travel thing would even bring you back to when you first discovered the laundry powder in the first place.

"Well," Autumn finished. "I'm sure you have a lot to think about. I'll leave you to it! Please contact me straight away if you run into any more problems."


"Uh, yes. Thank, thank you, Autumn."

"My pleasure! Good luck, Mr. Wallace!"

Hearing her pleasant tone almost made everything better.

Of course, she was right. You had a lot of thinking to do with Alice. She had listened in on everything that was said and watched you, crossing her arms.

"So, it looks like we have our work cut out for us," she said with a heavy sigh. "I think you should be the one to wear the necklace though, sweetie."

"Me?"

"You took the risk with drinking the vial, so I think it's only fair. Though we should discuss how to use this thing first."

You nodded and accepted the necklace. You did the clasp and let it dangle between your massive breasts. Like Autumn had said, there were three icons embedded into the gold surface.

Which were you going to try first to fix things?

Alice nodded, "According to what you've told me how the Witch Wash worked in the Reality Prime it seems that at least some Witch World Wide products heavily really on neural input. So you should create a picture in your mind the reality you want. Details would probably help."

You imagined yourself once again being high school student John Wallace who was enjoying his summer vacation when his life went a bit sideways. The Reality Altering Necklace let off a ruby red glow and you felt a bit lightheaded for a moment. You braced yourself against the lab table you were by and opened your eyes. You looked down at yourself and saw you still had Alice's body. "I knew Autumn said it only effected reality but I still kinda hoped it would change my body too. Oh well, I'll try to work on that later."

"Of course it wasn't going to do that John, that necklace has amazing powers but it's limits were already plainly told to us." Alice said visibly annoyed at you as though she had just caught you sleeping in chemistry class.

"Yeah well I still hoped that...wait, you called me John."

"Well, that's your name. Oh, is that what you changed? What all did you change exactly, give me details."

You did the first thing you thought to do to check if the changes worked, you checked your phone. And sure enough on your social media pages you were John Wallace, a 17 year old male once again. "It did what I wanted, I actually get to go to bed tonight as John Wallace...more or less," You motioned down at Alice's body, "but John Wallace never the less."

"I'm so proud of you John for overcoming this hurdle. It reminds me of when you were in middle school and you were just starting to blossom. You wanted to try out for the football team but I was being a worry wart, but you were so determined and made the team! Sure you're not optimal body was injured during the first game forcing you to quit, but even then I was so proud of you."

"Um, right." It seems even with the reality adjustments you made, your body still caused you some issues, but you could worry about those later. "But Alice...you know you're not really my mom. You only pretended to help me out just yesterday. Do you want to go back to being Alice, at least in reality if not body yet?"

"But...I know I've only technically been your mother for 24 hours. I know it to be true, but I feel like I've been Sarah Wallace my whole life. I don't even know how to be a high school student again."

"Well I can help out with that, or at least the necklace can. You don't even have to be just like the old Alice, I can make you whatever Alice you want to be."

For a moment you could have sworn you saw and honest to goodness twinkle behind Alice's eyes. "That's right, I can be anyone. You can put me in a position to make advancements in this new magical science. You can make me a researcher for Witch World Wide, you could make me someone who could train Briana properly in her size changing magic, you could make me the president of the universe!"

"I'm not making you president of the universe! I don't know you nearly well enough to want to do something like that!"

"You're right, in that position I wouldn't have enough time for scientific research. Better go with something else that was suggestion. Let's make a detailed powerpoint presentation detailing the plusses and minuses of each choice."

Not feeling like having a 12 hour discussion about how to use the Reality Altering Necklace on Alice you went ahead and made the decision for her.

You wondered briefly what would happen if you made Alice an employee to Witch World Wide. Granted, she'd probably be ecstatic given her apparent inquisitive nature. It sounded like a dream job for her. Plus, it would be a good way to arm yourselves to eventually wrestle Briana's power from her. If Alice was an employee there, certainly that would mean that she would have access to more gadgets and tools necessary to conquer the little brat.

It was a win/win either way, as far as you saw it. Though you were also quite certain this isn't what Autumn had in mind by offering you the amulet.

While Alice is prattling on, you grip the identity tab of the necklace and think of her new position. No longer is she an overworked mom, getting by in a lab job with poor funding. Instead, she's the newest researcher for Witch World Wide. She gets to explore new options and possibilities with magic all day.

You blink once and turn to her, expecting something to change. Though nothing does.

"John?" she asks. "Are you listening?"

"Uh, sure thing. Though shouldn't we be more focused on ways to deal with Briana rather than test the necklace, Alice?"

"Test the necklace? Why would I need to do that? I already helped invent the thing, I'm fully aware of its properties."

"Say what now?"

"We were talking about what tools we could use to deal with Briana given everything that's happened. Now, I have some unique things in the works here in the lab."

"Wait...Isn't this the local chemistry lab?"

"It was, but Witch World Wide wanted to give me my own space so I wouldn't have to move far from home. They bought out this part of the building and let me set up shop here. Among other benefits."

You don't get to ask what benefits she's talking about as she turned around and waddled for the nearby cabinets. When she opens them up with a lock and key, you find not your typical chemistry equipment, but things of a more fantastical nature. Eyeballs in jars, witch cauldrons, and exotic ingredients that had no business being in a science lab based on the labels for some of them. You also catch the familiar product of Witch Wash in the corner.

Alice ignores all that and begins digging around the drawers.

"Now, we need to bring her here to my lab somehow. That way I can forcibly remove her powers using a machine I have in the corner over there."

She gestured to what looked like an electric chair. You began to wonder how you even overlooked such a device.

"But she's probably going to suspect something given my job and won't come willingly," Alice explained to you. "So, we can approach the matter in two ways, as far as I'm concerned. The first is to bring her body here."

Alice holds up a zipper.

"What's that?" you asked.

"My latest test invention. A suit creator. Simply stick it on someone's back and unzip it and it will make the person into a wearable suit."

"...That's kind of fucked up."

"Language, young man. And it's perfectly harmless to the person. Closing the zipper and filling the suit with air will return them to normal. Then you can remove the zipper entirely at any time. It just hasn't gotten improved by the Coven yet, but it's a ready-to-go product. And it's the most stable option. The other..."

Alice moves to a triple locked door in the lab.

"I don't even want to begin to explain to you what tools I have in here," she goes on. "But they're all uniquely dangerous in their own way. From unstable teleportation tools to inflation runes. None of this stuff is properly tested. But it'd be coming at Briana with something she doesn't expect and leaves our options open. I'm going to leave the option up to you, John."

"Me?"

"You're the one who's going to be coming at her. She'll suspect me if I did it."

Once again, you were the one forced to solve your own problems with magic. At least now you had a proper armament of tools at your disposal. The zipper would be pretty useful in physically getting Briana's body to the lab. Though you wondered what sort of dangerous items Alice had invented in her new lab job. On top of it all though, you had a bad feeling going down your neck of something terrible approaching...

Briana wakes up and shrinks you before you can attach it
You put on the zippered body only to realize you used it on a real doll
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
As Alice began digging through her assortment of experimental magical tools you decided that the simplest (magic influenced) plan was the best. "Let's just go with the Zipper for now. It sounds like that's the best option for now."

Alice looked back at you with a look of disappointment on your mom's face. "Aw, but I really wanted to test out the...you know what. You're right, this is a time of action, not experimenting." It seemed to pain Alice a lot to say that, she hands you the zipper and continues, "Let's go ahead and get home. It's too late for you to get her body and make it back to the lab so let's wait until tonight. Besides it will probably be easier to do it when Briana is asleep."

"Sure Alice, that sounds good."

Another odd look came across Alice's face, "Ah yes, one more thing. I know you remember everything that happened before and how I'm not really your mom, but even though I know the truth now I think I'd prefer to be Sarah Wallace. And the Sarah Wallace from your...I mean our previous reality get's to be young again and experience life all over again."

"Are you sure, you're going to lose like 20 years of your life if you choose this."

Alice just smiled, "Oh John, those 20 years would be spent just trying to get to the position in life I am now with my dream job. And besides, I'm sure I'll be able to invent something that will get me 20 years back and then some eventually. In fact I've already started working on a watch that will..."

"Ok ok, if that's really what you want, then I guess I have to be cool with it...mom."

"Oh John." Alice started to tear up and your new mom gave you a big hug burying her face into your breasts, an experience that somehow probably didn't crack the top 20 weirdest thing that had happened this week.

That evening was a pleasant one. When you got back you went to your room and was happy to see everything was back to normal except for the fact that you had girl clothes and all your pictures had Alice's old body staring back at your instead of your old male one. But at least you had your game system. You turned on your Playstation and gamed for a while before Alice...no, mom called you for supper. You entered the kitchen to see a bowl of pasta the size of the table with your family all doll sized and practically swimming in spaghetti. "Get in!" Briana called out, and you took off your shoes and dipped your toes in the noodles, and as you did Briana pointed her right arm at you and you began to shrink to join them. As you started to eat a single noodle that would probably be enough to fill you up, you looked up and saw a giant Lucky the size of a cow nibbling away at the pasta. You were a little nervous at seeing your evil older Janet in a position where she could possibly eat you if she wanted, but then you remembered that this Lucky only acted like a dog. "Guess the reality change did have some up side." You said to yourself as you ate as much as you could.

After dinner everyone grew to get out of the bowl, but Briana once again decided everyone was going to go to sleep in the dollhouse again. Nobody argued but mom did give you a knowing nod. The plan was still a go.

After Briana shrunk everyone you made your way to the plastic couch and waited. After a few hours you heard the clock outside ring midnight. "She has to be asleep by now." You said as you made your way to the room you were sure you saw Briana go in. It was so dark you couldn't see an inch in front of your face so you slowly tip toed and felt for the bed. You found it and felt the lump under the covers. Gently you pulled back the blanket and carefully prepared to attach the zipper to your sister so you could take her powers and remove get them removed.
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.title: Try to use the zipper to get Briana's body.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
Movement in the dark tells you that you hit some sort of mark. And that whoever it is will be waking up in a matter of seconds. You don't have time to think as you slap the zipper on the person's back and pull.

"Who's ther--" asked a squeaky voice before being violently cut off.

There was a spray of hot air that smelled faintly of strawberries and blew back your long hair. Then nothing. Silence.

You fumble your way to the wall and find the light switch. The cheap battery powered lamp in the doll house activates to reveal who your victim was. Your little sister, Briana, was no more than a pile of skin in her own clothes that she had been wearing. The zipper had worked!

A pang of relief and guilt washed over you as you begin to think of what to do next.

"Alic--I mean, mom!" you called out through the plastic hall. "Can you come here, please?"

You tried to be as quiet as possible as to not wake Minnie. Or "Lucky" who was sleeping outside the dollhouse like a guard dog. Thankfully, your mom managed to hear you and stumbled wearing one of the robes from the Barbie dolls.

"John? What's wrong?"

"I did it," you stand by proudly and hold up the shriveled remains of Briana. "Look. And it was easier than I thought it would be too!"

"It really worked then?" she asked. "Wonderful. That means I can take her safely back to the lab and study her to eventually find a way to safely purge her powers from her body."

"And get me back to my normal body," you added.

She rolled her eyes and examined Briana's deflated form. "Yes, of course. But for now, first thing's first. I need to bring Briana to the lab first thing in the morning and...And...Uh oh."

"What?" you asked. "What's wrong? Did it not work?"

"No, no. It worked...In a sense. But a thought just occurred to me. We're in the dollhouse."

"Yeah?"

"And the lab is for normal sized humans. Briana was the one who could shrink and grow us at will. So..."

"We're stuck like this?" you groaned. "I thought you would come prepared for something like this!"

"I wasn't sure you were going to do this tonight when we were all diminished, sweetie! And Briana always checks me for stuff I bring home from the lab in case she wants to play with me."

"Great...," surprisingly after all that you had been through, being stuck pint-sized didn't have nearly the amount of anguish that you thought it would. "Alright. Fine. We'll fix this. What are our options to get back to normal size?"

"Well...There is this suit," your mom holds up Briana's deflated body. "In theory, if you wore it then you would have access to all of Briana's traits. Including her powers."

Become Briana? You had changed your forms so many times the past few days, that the thought of actually becoming Briana didn't exactly phase you. But it still felt weird, considering she was a kid.

"What else can we do?" you asked.

"Well, there's always the Witch Wash clothes in the basement, which should bring us back to normal size. But that's a long way there. And Briana has Lucky trained to keep look out on the dollhouse."

You had wondered why she kept Lucky at normal size.

"Anything else?"

Your mom fiddles with her fingers. "...I could try a simple growth or teleportation spell. I've been studying them while working for the company, even though I don't have my Witch license yet. I can't promise it will work. But if you don't like any of those other options, I figured it's worth a try."

None of those options held high appeal. You thought for a moment which you would be willing to try.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
It would be nice if your mom's magic experiments were a sure thing to work, but they weren't and it'd be pretty dangerous to test out stuff now when you were trapped in a dollhouse. And leaving the dollhouse with the gigantic Lucky on guard duty to go to the basement was dangerous, and even then there was no guarantee you'd be able to wash clothes at your size. Looking down at the pile of skin and clothes in your hands you felt you only had one option. "So do I need to take off my clothes before I put this on, because I really don't want to be naked in my little sister's skin suit."

Your mom seemed happy you were willing to test the zipper further, "Oh no dear, you just have to step in and get zipped in. No mess at all."

You held out your little sister's skin still not quite believing this husk was really her, you opened the zipper area wide and step in. You felt the familiar feeling of your leg being magically compressed to perfectly fit into a tight space. Before putting more of yourself in you ask, "And Briana doesn't feel or know what's going on at all, right?"

"No, when you leave the suit and we inflate her back up it will be as though she were waking up from a nap."

"All right, here goes nothing." And you continued to become your little sister. You put your other foot in and stood up on your little sisters own two feet. You wiggled her little toes to make sure everything was working right, and sure enough it was. You stretched her tiny chest over your much larger one and as soon as you got the suit over your shoulders you looked down and saw that your chest was as flat as Briana, and her nightgown she was wearing was going from the rubbery like material like the suit was to it's former flowy glory. All that was left was the seemingly rubber mask that was Briana's face. Taking a deep breath, you pulled the material over your face. You felt a mild magical compression and opened your eyes to see mom looking at you.

"I'll zip you up to make sure you're snug in there." And you felt a cold hand on your zipper, which it turns out you felt as though it were a part of your body, and she zipper it up. The zipper going up felt like chainsaw was moving up your back, but thankfully without the pain that would be involved. You looked up at Alice and said, "Ok, it looks like it worked, I look and sound like Briana now."

"That's because you are her thanks to the zipper. But now for the real test, try out Briana's powers." You nodded and were about to step outside to use the powers on yourself when you remembered Lucky the guard dog and a smile spread across your face. You peeked out a plastic window and saw the cow sized Lucky laying down outside the dollhouse, but with pointed ears listening for anyone who tried to escape. With your smile getting bigger on Briana's face you pointed your right arm at Lucky and with a little bit of concentration you felt like you were shooting an invisible beam out of your hand that hit Lucky. Sure enough the giant dog was shrinking down, down, down until it was the size of a chihuahua, at least when compared to your current size. You had just shrunk Lucky down until she was maybe an inch tall if that. The dog seemed to notice the changes rather quickly and let out a scared yelp and ran for the dollhouse where it went behind Alice and began shaking like a leaf. "Wimp." You said happy to see her in her place.

Alice began to clap, "Well done, that proves it, you can use Briana's powers and will be able to get to the lab tomorrow no problem."

"Tomorrow? Can't we go now? I want to get this over with."

"John, it's almost 1 o clock in the morning. The lab isn't open and with Briana's body in your control we aren't in a rush. Just get a good nights sleep and we'll head out bright and early."

You didn't feel like it was worth it to try to talk her into breaking into her own lab, so you turned back to Briana's dollhouse room and crawled into the bed. As you lay there you couldn't help but feel how weird you felt in Briana's body. You'd been tiny before, in fact you'd been smaller than you were now, but you'd always been an adult. With Briana's 10 year old body you felt so...puny. These feeling made it hard to go to sleep. On top of that there was the piece of metal attached to your back that made laying down annoying. Eventually you finally drifted off and wondered what tomorrow might bring when you made it to the lab.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
"Alright," said your mom as you both climbed into the car that morning. "Let's get there and put this mess behind us, once and for all. After we're done, you can just rewrite reality so that Briana never knew she had powers in the first place."

You sighed in mild content at putting this business behind you while playing with the amulet.

After an uncomfortable night's rest with the zipper on your back, you woke up with everyone and had a quick breakfast after growing everyone back to normal size with your new powers. You had to admit, it will a little fun to make giant toast with a poke of your fingers. You then got changed and joined Alice in the car for going to work, with Minnie in tow since you didn't have a babysitter.

Minnie was perfectly content in her own little world in the backseat while you and your mom discussed your next moves.

"Will this hurt?" you asked.

"It shouldn't. All it's doing is sucking the powers out of you and storing them in liquid form. I'll be sending it to Witch HQ for further study."

There was a loud buzzing noise as Alice reached into her pocket.

"Speaking of Witch HQ," she muttered. "Hello?"

You started to tune her out as she delved into work talk with her manager on the other line. With Briana's body, you seemed to be inheriting her attention span as well and you stared out the window at the passing world.

You absentmindedly pointed at a few things, growing them and shrinking them slightly. Nothing bad. A shrunken tree here. A giant tricycle there. No people, you decided. But just enough to confuse folks and give them a good laugh later. It was kind of neat to have this unlimited power at your fingertips. It was almost sad to see it go away...

"Alright, alright," Alice said in a louder volume, sounding exasperated. "I'll come straight away...Bye."

She hung up and sighed.

"Change of plans. They need me to come into a meeting at HQ."

"What?" you asked. "But what about our plan? I don't want to be stuck like this forever!"

"It's only for a little while, sweetie. We'll run by the lab before the end of the day sometime. Just for today. You can pretend you're a little girl, again. Doesn't that sound fun?"

"Considering I never was a little girl to begin with?"

"Fair enough," she sighed. "Just deal with it for today, okay John? I need to drop you and Minnie both off at the day care they have in HQ. They'll look after you while I'm in my meeting. By stay out of trouble in the meantime, okay?"

You crossed your arms and glared at Alice. Even with all your new powers, it was impossible to say no to her. Especially since she would be the one who knew how to work the machine.

"Fine."

"That's my girl."

~

Witch HQ was unassuming on the outside. Just a typical office building with cement and glass.

The inside, however, was much larger than it appeared. You found yourself being led by your mother's hand into a glorious lobby with a massive water fountain in the middle. You passed a sign that said "Wishing Fountain - Wishes must be approved by staff of Level 4 or higher" next to the ledge. There were at least twenty different elevators going in all directions. Up and down. Sideways and diagonally. You managed to make up a few details on the buttons that said "Witching R&D."

Alice pulled you and Minnie both down a hallway at the first floor. She showed you to a massive room with screaming children being overlooked by a bored looking office intern.

"Alright," she said. "Now, just wait here and I'll come pick you up after lunch. Keep an eye on your sister, okay?"

You nodded and surveyed your "peers" and the toys they were playing with. None of them looked particularly bright, but all the toys they handled were...Odd. There was a sentient doll that seemed to move on its own, as well as a toy cauldron that was really bubbling with some odd mixture.

You had a full day with time to kill while Alice was off being an adult. And being stuck in daycare didn't hold much appeal with a bunch of bratty nosepickers standing around.

"Well," Minnie said to you. "This looks fun..."

You rolled your eyes and passed Minnie your necklace. "Here, if you play with this do you promise not to follow me around?"

Minnie fiddled with the necklace. "Why? What are you going to do?"

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
As lame as you thought it was to be stuck in a day care with a bunch of elementary school aged kids you had to admit that there was a charm to it. Some of this charm came from the fact just about every kid had some sort of fantastical toy. A couple of 12 year olds were chasing each other around on brooms and stick horses that all hovered a few inches off the ground, a bunch of little girls were gathered around dolls that were all having actual tea party's under their supervision, and even the babies in the group were having fun with rattles that changed colors with each shake, simple but effective.

Curiously you approached a boy about Briana's age who had a pile of goo that kept changing into different bugs before getting squashed into goo and starting the cycle anew. "What do you got there?" You asked genuinely curious, the boy hugged his goo close to him getting it all over his shirt. "This is mine girl get your own." You strongly considered making this brat tiny and see if he liked the threat of getting squashed into goo, but maturity took over and you simply said, "Whatever, where do I get something like that?"

"Ask that guy," The boy pointed at the bored looking intern who wasn't even paying attention to the kids he was in charge of and was just messing with his phone. "He'll get you something if you ask, but it won't be as cool as this." The boy said as the goo formed into a spider and crawled on his shoulder. "I'll do that." You said, but before you left the kid you pointed your right arm at him and shrunk him an inch. Satisfied with your really minor version of revenge you made your way to the intern. He was a guy who was maybe 20 years old and was just on phone, by his finger motions he was probably playing some game on company time. You gave a fake cough to get his attention, "Hey, I want a cool toy or something." You say, since you were stuck here yo might as well have fun.

The guy sighed and put his phone down for a second and put on a fake smile, "Sure thing little girl, where at Witch World Wide we have only the finest toys provided fresh from the R&D office for play testing. And once you're done you get to have double the fun by filling out a super cool survey! Doesn't that sound fun!"

"Uh, sure, where's the fun stuff?"

The intern snapped his fingers and a box appeared in front of you. It was filled to the brim with all sorts of toys. You felt overwhelmed looking about all the colors and shapes in the box, probably due to having been influenced by Briana's attention span. So you just grabbed the first thing that caught your eye and left to go examine it. You found the corner of the room where Minnie was just lost in her own thoughts and examined the toy that you grabbed for yourself.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
"A book?"

You were so dazzled and rushed by the intern that you didn't even look to see what your grubby little hands had grabbed from the box. Minnie looked up from playing with the necklace to see what you were going on about.

"It looks...Pretty?"

That much was true. You had grabbed the most colorful thing you could find in the box and while there had been many things that drew your attention, the cover of the book was something else entirely. The author had filled it with every color of the rainbow and then some. The mess of flavor was spilling from what looked to be a black cauldron with a child-like witch stirring at it. In sparkling, glitter letters you read out the words.

"First Grade Spells: Standard Edition."

"A spellbook?" Minnie asked, suddenly dropping her interest in the amulet. "Lemme see, lemme see."

"Hang on," you mutter, shoving her away slightly. Being at Briana's height, you were just slightly taller than her but she had her weight on you from all her snacking. You might have to take a few inches from her to even the odds. "I got it, so I should have to look at it first."

"Fine..."

Though that reasoning wins Minnie over, it clearly doesn't satisfy her. She crossed her arms and glared at you as you opened the cover and began reading.

"Everyone can learn spells," you muttered out loud. "It's as easy as math or reading! But it's easier the younger you are. This is book is supposed to help you kids get started to becoming your own witch or wizard!"

You pause. Had you unwittingly been handed the means to which you could become a master spellcaster?

You had already gotten a taste of that kind of power with Briana's size changing abilities. You could only imagine what it would be like with a wide range of spells and charms. Even Minnie had a hungry look in her eyes.

"...Chapter One: Basic Charms. Most spells require a basic set of ingredients. A power source, like a battery. And ignition source, like keys to your parent's car. And a set of instructions for the spell, like a math problem."

You had to roll your eyes at the simplistic nature of the language. But it was helping you understand how spells worked a little better. Especially as it went on.

"Charms are easy because they handle two of those requirements by their very nature! You attack as the battery of the charm and the incantation is the ignition for the charm! All you need to know is the instructions to cast the charm."

You nodded along. This was easy enough to understand. You eyes trailed down to the list of basic charms you cast with a limited amount of knowledge. Each only had a simple set of words you had to speak, some instructions on how to cast it, and the cost of using it. Most of the time, they were simple little requires. A strand of hair. A fingernail. The most intense thing you could find was a prick of your own blood.

You licked at your lips and turned to see what some of the charms could actually do.

There was one that was for changing the size of clothing to whatever you'd like. That would be fun for later with the laundry powder. There was also one that would allow you to undo locks of doors or lock things up. That could be handy for escaping the day care, if you wanted to explore more. Alternatively, Minnie was eying the book eagerly. Perhaps she would like to try something.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
Ever since your mom had bumped her head and you'd turned her into the amnesiac Minnie she'd been very subdue. She never seemed to fight back against anything anyone told her and seemed perfectly happy with her body and life without questioning anything. But maybe it was because she'd become more comfortable with her body or maybe the concussion or whatever she had was getting better but Minnie had a detained look in her eyes. "It's not fair."

"What was that Minnie?" You ask thrown off by the annoyed tone in her voice.

"It's not fair. Mom has her cool job and John gets to go help her a lot. And you have your shrink and grow powers and now you have a cool book. And what do I have? Nothing. I don't like that anymore." Minnie took off her necklace and threw it to the ground. You practically dived for it to make sure Minnie hadn't damaged the reality altering necklace. It didn't seem dented or anything, but when you looked up you saw Minnie was moving for the toy box full of magic items. Items that you really didn't want your mom turned sister messing with. "Wait Minnie! Don't get something, I'll share the book with you, see?" You offered her the First Grade Spells book but Minnie wasn't interested.

"I'm not interested in that book, I want something for someone my age."

"Your age?" It suddenly hit you that you didn't know how old Minnie actually was. Her body was based off of Janet after you purposely shrunk her clothes in the wash. You'd made her smaller than Briana even but you actually didn't know how old she was perceived as.

"I'm 14 years old and you know it." Minnie seemed a little hurt you didn't know how old she was and went off to get her own magical gadget. You considered just shrinking her and stopper her by force, but sadly you were still in public and while all the kids where distracted with their own toys, it was too much to hope for that nobody would notice you using powers that could get you into big trouble. And so you did the only thing a could do, you pouted and browsed the spell book. Out of boredom as you waited for Minnie to return you plucked a hair from Briana's head and said a minor incantation, felt a drain of energy from your gut, and Briana's reddish hair turned blue. "Can't wait to see the look on Briana's face when I reinflate her," you said with a chuckle.

After a few more minutes Minnie came strutting back with a very cocky look on her face and holding something behind her back. "So Minnie...what'd you get?" You ask both nervously and out of curiosity.

Minnie smiled, "I got something that makes me special like you. You don't get to be the only one with powers at home now. And I'm going to show you how." And before you could stop her, Minnie took her toy out from behind her back and pointed it at Briana. Unfortunately since you were in Briana's skin suit that meant she was pointing it at you. You only had a second to take in what Minnie was using on you before it began to take effect.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
"Try this on for size," she muttered as she aimed what looked like a tiny, golden pocket watch in your direction.

You put up your tiny arms in a meager defense as a ray of violent light envelopes your body. You winced at its warmth and felt a tingling sensation travel down your hands and into your very core. You had been through enough these past few days to recognize when you were being transformed. You could only sit back in horror as the changes got to work on you.

Your entire body began to swell upwards to the point where you, at first, thought you were being forced to grow. Though that much was true, you also realized that wasn't quite the case either.

Briana's body was far from developed and you glanced down when you sensed a growing weight on your chest. You gasped as underneath the dress you were wearing was the developing sign of most Wallace women. Breasts. And big ones at that. It was starting to become quite tight in the tiny clothes you were wearing. Tears began to occur along the seams.

"Minnie!" you yelled in a more mature voice. "Stop!"

Though she doesn't as you slowly realize what's happening to you. You were getting older. In an instant, you soar from a bratty age of 10 to your teens and well beyond into your 20's. Briana's body fully develops into that of a beautiful young woman with all the rights curves, though none of the chub yet. Your dress struggles to hold together as you reach a new height, going from a pint sized 3'8 to a petite 5'2. You now tower over Minnie.

"What did you do, you little brat?" you ask, sounding almost like Janet.

Fortunately, you aren't the only one who takes notice of this. The intern puts down his phone and goes to stop Minnie as well, Minnie, however, is ready for him.

She aims the pocket watch at him and you watch as a purple beam shoots out this time. He looked confused for a moment before he started to dwindle into his own clothes.

In a matter of seconds, there's a crying baby boy in the hoodie and jeans left behind.

"You're going to get us in trouble," you protest. "Give that back."

Minnie refuses and runs out the door without the intern guarding it. You attempt to give chase, but in your new body you find yourself unbalanced. Without a bra, your breasts are all over the place and you find it difficult to run in a cramped clothing. Minnie is already gone before you can peek your head out.

"Great," you mutter. "More problems..."

Obviously, you need to go looking for her before she causes more chaos. But you know that the second she sees you, she's going to make a break for it. Thankfully, she's left some tools behind to stop her. You still have the reality necklace, which you might be able to use to change things around somehow. Perhaps you can make yourself appear like a stranger to her and win her trust that way. There's also the zipper. If it can make Briana into a suit, it can work the same on other people. A disguise will allow you to get in close to her before she can do more harm to Briana's body and get you in more trouble.

Alternatively, you could just use your size powers but you know that the more people who see that, the more trouble your mom will be in.

Alice arrives on cue ready to take you to the lab

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
You wanted so badly to just point your right arm at Minnie and shrink her down so she couldn't get away. It'd be so easy, it might even be fun. Briana seemed to get a kick out of using her powers so why shouldn't you have fun with them? "No, we're trying to remove them not use them." You said gritting your now adult teeth and bitting the inside of your mouth a bit. You then considered the zipper but the only person in the day care who might be able to efficiently sneak up on Minnie was the intern and he was currently crying as from the smell of things he was loosing bowel control.

You knew what to do, "Looks like I'm using you again." You said as you fiddled with the necklace that had falling in between your sister's cleavage. You pulled it out but the sudden movement caused the dress intended for a 10 year old rip a little bit more. Looking at the baby intern you said, "Sorry pal," And grabbed his Witch World Wide jacket and pants and put them on. They didn't fit very well, the pants were so long on you that you had to roll them up about 5 times and you had to hold the pants up as you walked. You actually cursed Briana's genes for not following in her mom's footsteps and having an overweight body. So now with some clothes on you began to fiddle with the medallion. The uniform gave you an idea. You made yourself an intern for Witch World Wide and on top of that you made yourself Minnie's best friend. She was sure to trust you now. So with both hands holding up your new pants you ran after your troublesome sister.

It wasn't very difficult to find which was Briana went, she left a small trails of baby's, pre teens, and confused looking elderly people in her wake. Thankfully it looked like Minnie had gotten distracted and stopped by a vending machine for a minute. Hoping the reality change worked like you'd hoped you called out, "Hey Minnie! What's up?"

Minnie picked up a chocolate bar and said, "Hey Briana! Just getting a snack before I have more fun! We've still got time before my mom comes to take your powers away. Are you sure you don't want to use them? We can probably combine our powers and have lots of fun." Minnie waved her age changing pocket watch in the air and smiled a mischievous grin. 'Well, it looks like Briana and Janet did indeed inherit their mischievous streets from Mom, but you did feel that pang of wanting to have fun with these powers while you had the chance. I mean, Witch World Wide probably had stuff like this happen often so you probably wouldn't get more than a slap on the wrist as punishment if that.

Sneak around using your size powers.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
Before you could even respond to Minnie, she froze up suddenly and dropped her candy bar. A blue light had pounded her on the side of her chubby shoulder and she looked like she wanted to scream. But she couldn't move and fell over like a statue, blinking but solid.

A glance over you shoulder told you what had happened.

"Got the trouble maker," said a man wearing heavy black armor, like he was someone from a SWAT team. "Bringing her in for questioning now."

"Questioning?" you asked out loud. "Wait, what's going on?"

"Stand back, miss. We have everything under control."

"That's my...Friend!" you said as you watched the other armored men hoisted up Minnie and carry her away like a piece of furniture. "Hang on, what did you do to her? Where are you taking her?"

"Level One Employees are not allowed to inquiry matters regarding Level Five security," growled the man. "They should have taught you that at internship training. Now, if you'll excuse me..."

You watch as the man bends out to collect both the candy bar and the pocket watch that Minnie dropped. Then he turns to you and snatches the amulet from you hands.

"Hey!"

"Standard protocol. All magical objects within twenty meters of an improper occurrence must be confiscated. You will be returned this once we confirm it wasn't responsible for this chaos. Unless you have something else to report?"

You briefly ponder shrinking the man and crushing him like a bug. But a glance to the other security guards tells you that they still have their guns at the ready. They look like machine guns only with a blue tint to them. You guess that's how they captured Minnie, by freezing her with them. Even if you did manage to shrink them all before they could get you, you can't risk exposing your powers if there's more guards like this in the building.

"...No, sir."

"Then please carry on to the medical wing at level three, room 304. They'll correct any aftereffects you may have experienced from this incident."

He salutes you and carries on about his duty, walking away with both Minnie and your reality bending tool.

Well, this is another fine mess you're in. Alice is going to kill you if she learns that you allowed Minnie to go on a rampage and get captured. Not mention, they've stolen your amulet and now you're not even John Wallace anymore, but Briana who is an intern for the corporation.

You sighed and leaned against the wall in your much-too-tight-clothing. You need to get Minnie and the amulet back before you or your mother gets into trouble. But there's no telling where they could have taken her. And, as an intern, you don't know how much clearance you have to go about the office building.

You glance down at a nearby ventilation grate. You could always use your powers to do a little infiltration. You're used to it at this point, after that stint in the school.

Then again, if it was clearance you were after, you could always disguise yourself as a higher up employee with your zipper powers.
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.title: Captured!

You're on Alice's head as she finishes work for the day
You're on a strange looking pillow in evidence lockup by the watch and medallion
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
You were really hoping you wouldn't actually need to use Briana's size changing powers, especially in such a place where you could get into big trouble, but desperate times called for desperate measures. Without the reality altering medallion to fix things and Minnie getting locked up in magical jail for all you knew now was that desperate time. In the room you were in where people were still abuzz about the incident with security, you took advantage of everyone being distracted by quickly and quietly moved to the closest vent. It was luckily beside a giant rainbow colored pillar so you were less likely to be see. So after making sure nobody was looking at the unasuming intern, you pointed your own right arm at yourself and you shrunk down and down. You mentally willed yourself to shrink as quickly as you could and in less than a second you were mean inches tall.

Not wasting any time you jumped as high as your little legs would let you and reached for the vent opening and successfully crawled into it. Everything was dark and metal. You could only see a few beams of light shooting out from other room. "Don't worry Minnie, Jonn's coming for you." You said to amp yourself up and you began your trek.

Every step caused a tiny clang that to you sounded like gong being hit, but probably wasn't noticed by anyone outside unless they really listened for it. You peeked in every grate opening you passed hoping to see either the necklace or Minnie, but sadly you only saw labs, forests, dungeons, and offices. Eventually the long twisting and turning metal vents began to angle up. You climbed up the metal hill until you were now looking down on rooms. But you still didn't find any useful clues. You were wondering if it would be better to just go back to normal size and try to find everything the old fashion way, when you heard an odd squeek behind you. Curiously you turned and saw a rat that size of a car and it was looking at you with hungry eyes.

Panic. That' was the only thing you thought about as you ran as fast as you could, but the rat was catching up with ease. You felt like you could feel it's breath on your zipper that was still on your back. After running around a corner though, you tripped over your ill fitting pants and slammed onto the dusty vent floor. You saw the rat was about to pounce. With what might be your last thought you began cursing yourself for not using Briana's powers to custom fit your clothes properly.

Wait a second, you still had powers! You pointed your right arm at the rat and closed your eyes and prayed. A moment later a millimeter tall rat was running up your pants leg. "Hahaha stop that! That tickles!" You kicked the walls of the vent and rolled around in a fit of laughter. You were laughing so hard you didn't even notice that you had just kicked open a vent. And you were rolling so wildly you didn't notice you were falling until you hit something oddly soft. You finally came to your senses and looked down to see what you had landed on.

1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
You come up gasping for air in a literal sea of red just in time to see a huge face pass you by.

"Shit," you whisper. "Down, down, shrink down."

Point at yourself again and feel your whole body contract and dwindled as you drop from inches to mere centimeters. If you were standing next to a ruler, you'd see that you're half an inch tall. Just big enough to hide around in the mess of scarlet from the passing head.

"This is absolutely unacceptable, Miss Wallace," booms a voice. "What are we even giving you funding for?"

Your hideaway rumbles as another voice speaks. "I'm sorry, sir...I'm trying to find a way. There's about to be a big breakthrough, I promise. And the zipper was quite effective--"

"We already have thirty different products that can alter people's appearances at will! Do you know how many potential lawsuits we could face with a device that turns people, unwillingly, into suits? We're going to have to pay our lawyers through the nose just to afford working the terms of service, let alone the gymnastics they're going to have to do for it to be legally bidding for the customers."

You risked a peek out of the strands towards the direction of the bossy voice. You learn two things.

One, the man who is speaking is actually the Head of R&D at Witch HQ, Desmond Wurch. You knew him from your implanted memories after you had altered reality to make Briana an intern. He's a tall, macho man who is balding so he makes up for it by shouting at people. He has hair going all down his buff arms and barrel chest which is barely contained in his polo shirt. What's more is that he's Alice's boss.

Speaking of Alice, you quickly determined that the sea of red you were in was not an ocean at all. Rather, it was the head of your mother. You were presently swimming in her long, red locks at less than an inch tall. While she was getting scolded at work.

"But this new project I'm working will be something else, sir," she claimed. "You'll see. I've never seen anything like it."

"So you keep promising. Yet you turn up with nothing. Do I have to remind you how much of a waste of company resources it is to keep your precious little lab funded off of the corporate lot?"

You can feel Alice wince and you do the same. Desmond was rather infamous around the office for yelling at people, sometimes until he made them cry.

"Let me put it another way, Miss Wallace," growled Desmond. "Unless I see something from you by the end of the work week, I'll have your resignation papers waiting right here. Impress me or you're fired."

What an absolute bastard. You see Alice's lip quiver below you.

This was her dream job, so she told you herself. You can't just sit by and watch this jerk stomp on that. The childish side of Briana is coming out of you as you think of a quick way to get even with the jerk.

You could always bring him down a few inches. Desmond lords his height over your mother, standing over her at six feet tall. But that might get you noticed. A tickle down your leg causes you to squeak.

You grasp what's offending you and find the rat from before try crawling its way down your body. It must have gotten shrunk with your own shrinking and now is barely a fraction of the size it once was. Though you consider how Desmond might react to a giant rat suddenly attacking him. It might prove a good distraction to in order to get Minnie out of security.

Then again, there's still the matter of Minnie. Perhaps you should come clean to Alice now and get her help. Though you can see that getting you in loads of trouble.

Minnie is shrunken in a rat cage with your reality medallion
The real Sarah Wallace is back after security dispelled all magic on her
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
As you spit Alice's hair out of your mouth you felt completely overwhelmed not only by hair but by everything. Ever since you first discovered the Witch Wash in your mom's laundry room you had gotten into more and more trouble no matter what you did. Everything seemed to go wrong for you no matter what. So if things were going to go wrong, you might as well have fun and do things you wanted to do. "Screw it." You said pushing more hair out of the way and pointed your right arm at Mr. Desmond Wurch and let it rip. Down, down, down the bald man went until yo could no longer even see his shiny head from your point of view. You felt the ocean of hair violently shake like tidal waves. You knew Alice knew you must have used your powers on her boss, and you guessed she was looking around for you. Figuring you might as well let her in on it you took a breath and dove down into the tangled jungle of hair and kicked the top of her head. You felt a giant hand gently pat around and finally on you as Alice confirmed you were indeed on her head.

"Miss Wallace!" A much less intimidating sounding Desmond shouted up to Alice. As Alice looked down you got a peek at your victim and you laughed as you saw that the tiny angry man must only be about an inch tall. Alice bent down to make sure she could hear her boss. "Is this what you've been working on recently Miss Wallace? Are you responsible for this?"

Alice seemed to be debating whether she should take credit, blame you, or feign ignorance but she only thought about it for a second as she said, "You know what Mr. Wurch. Yes I am."

There was a terribly tense moment as you expected her boss to start going off on a tirade and fire her on the spot, "Fantastic work Miss Wallace! I'm only what, 1/60 my normal size and after being shrunk I feel no adverse effects at all! No vertigo, no vomiting, no negative side effects what so ever! Brilliant work Miss Wallace, you shall be getting a pay raise for this. Assuming you can reverse the process as well."

Once again Alice took a moment to determine her response, and you could hear the smile on her face as she said, "I'll have it on your desk by the end of the work week."

"Wonderful! You're free to go, but tell my secretary on the way out I'm going to need my wife to pick me up and drop me off at work for the rest of the week."

"Will do." She said as she left the office. As soon as she was out of site from any other Witch World Wide employees she put her hand on her head palm up. You took the invitation and stepped on it leading to her holding you in front of her face. "So Briana, do you want to explain to me why you're in my hair and no watching my only daughter?"

"Well that's a funny story..." So you told her about everything that happened since you and Minnie got dropped off at the daycare and how Minnie went rogue with the age changing pocket watch. You didn't even bother telling her that you were actually her son named John wearing the aged skin of her youngest daughter Briana because reality changing was just too annoying to explain, besides, you could fix it later probably.

"Well, that means Briana's probably in lock up. Let's go get her." And without her even offering to put you on the ground to get your size back, Alice put you back in her hair as she went straight to security. "I understand my daughter caused a little trouble today, mind if I take her off your hands?" An annoyed looking security officer checked Alice's clearance and gave the go ahead. A minute later the guard came back with Minnie looking different than you'd last seen her.

Alice wants to make Minnie a clone mentally to do twice the work at the lab.
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
Strangely enough, this was only the second time that two clones of your mother had met face to face in the past week. You didn't think you'd have to deal with Minnie getting her memories back. But there she was. Sarah Wallace. The real one. Staring Alice right in the face with a very guilty expression about her while wearing what looked to be an orange jumpsuit.

"We dispelled all the magic done to your...Daughter, ma'am," explained the security guard. "Though she looks just like you. We attempted to reverse any mental changes, but they appear to be non-magical."

Of course they would. Unlike the reality changing necklace, the memory loss done to your mother had been as a result of physical damage when she fainted and hit her head on the stairs, all the way back when this mess began.

She was still Minnie, but she had her adult body now.

"We also found these items around the area," he handed Alice the amulet and the pocket watch. "Since you're her...guardian, we figured you would know best what to do with them."

Alice paused for a few moments and you turned away as she glanced in your direction, still hiding in her hair.

"I see. Thank you, sir. I'll take her from here. This is all part of a new experiment we're conducting in R&D. Very powerful magics beyond your typical dispellers."

The guard huffed and muttered under his breath as he turned away. "Bloody whackado witches in R&D..."

Minnie gingerly approached Alice, looking down at the floor.

"So...Sorry, mommy. I started changing people's ages and then the man stopped me. Then they rubbed some blue stuff over me and I turned into you. Now...Now...I dunno what's going on. I just wanted to be special like you. And Briana."

"You're bad influence on her," Alice muttered under her breath loud enough that you could hear her. "It's fine, dear. I understand. You feel left out."

She nodded. Suddenly, you felt a little bad for her. It wasn't her fault she was constantly subjected to the magical influences that your misadventures.

"...What if I said you could be special in your own way, Minnie? What if I said you could help mommy with her work?"

"But...But I thought Briana was your intern."

"You can be even more special than she is. You can..."
