Stay as 21 year old Briana the intern and experiment
You accidentally active the pocket watch and turn into a baby
1131112112222232113221132211311131223111.content:
"You know what you can do Minnie? You can be something better than special. You can be just like me. I've got a machine back in my lab that will let you come to work with me every day and work at my side and get paid more than peanuts." You had a feeling Alice was talking about you when she said that. "How does that sound Minnie?" Minnie's eyes were wide with a youthful excitement you had never seen on your mom's face before. "That sounds like the best mommy! Can we go now?" "We absolutely can go now. Let's head to the car."

The walk to the car was a bumpy ride for you and drew some odd looks from onlookers. You could have sworn Alice was walking with a weird shake in her head just to mess with you, and Minnie was walking with a skip to her step. But as odd as seeing two Sarah Wallace's acting like this was, it still seemed to be only a 3/10 on the weirdness scale at Witch World Wide as the odd looks didn't linger very long.

When you all got to the car Alice said aloud, "Seat belts everyone." Minnie quickly obliged, she seemed happy that she was now tall enough to be able to use the seat belt comfortably. "I mean everyone Briana." "Oh yeah, you mean me." You said absent mindedly as you grew yourself a little bit in her hair to make a climb down a little easier. Although it was still an awkward climb as you slipped at you landed on her breasts and slid into her cleavage causing Alice to stare and Minnie to giggle in ecstasy. "Oops. Sorry." You meekly said as you finally climbed out and into the back seat where you used your left arm to grow yourself to 7 feet tall to make up for being so small today. "And I believe these are yours." Alice said passing back the reality altering necklace and age changing pocket watch to you. "Oh right, thanks." You said as you put on the necklace. You went to put the pocket watch in your pocket, but upon further inspection it didn't look like Witch World Wide intern uniforms had pockets to them. 'What the heck? Are they that paranoid about their stuff getting stolen?' You thought as you attached the pocket watch to the necklace chain and stole it from the building.

The ride to the lab mostly consisted of Minnie asking questions about the lab and what she was going to get to do, Alice just simply said that she will see but she'd have more privilages than a certain intern. You didn't even need to shrink yourself to feel small as she said this.

Finally at the lab Alice made you help her pull two wooden chairs from a side room with wires strapped to them and a colander attached at the top. "Why does every thing you intent look like a dang electric chair?" You asked as you pointed to the almost exactly the same looking Power Draining chair you'd have to use later. "Well, as the foremost expert of magical science, a field not respected by most in the scientific or magical community I don't get a lot of funding. So I have make do, with what I can afford and I can afford wires, thrown out chairs, and some kitchen supplies. Although after your stunt with my boss earlier that might actually change. Thanks for that by the way. Well done, even if it was foolish." You took it as a compliment as you appreciated what Alice could do with so little and the thought of what she could do if she could afford stuff scared you a little.

Alice instructed Minnie to sit in one of the Memory Transfer chairs and strapped her in while adjusting some wires. She then sat herself down in her own chair and looked to you. "Now you will go flick the 3rd light switch from the left. It sticks some times so give it a few flicks just to make sure." You went to do as you were told and after you flicked the switch for a 4th time sparks and a strange aura came from the two chairs where the two Sarah Wallace's sat convulsing. You were terrified for a moment you had electrocuted your mom and your alternate reality mom, but thankfully the sparks and shaking stopped. When it did you approached Minnie and removed the colander from her head. "Minnie? Are you ok?"

Minnie blinked a few times before looking at you with cool and calculated eyes, "While I understand why you have just referred to me as Minnie, I think it would be more appropriate if you called me Sarah Wallace since that is who I appear to be now to the rest of the world."

"I agree." Alice said, "And since you will be Sarah Wallace I think I should take up a more permeant alternative name. How about...Alice. That feel right."

"This is great! It worked and the name thing is nice. I was afraid I'd have to get used to calling you Mom 1 and Mom 2."

The two Wallace twins looked to each other, Alice said, "Why would you call us mom?"

Sarah added, "While interns can tend to view employees as maternal figures at times, it is not healthy or acceptable to refer to either of us as your mother."

You gave yourself a face palm, you forgot the world viewed you as Briana the 21 year old intern. You began to adjust the necklace so that you were back to being John in the skin suit of your 10 year old sister Briana, but you hesitated. This could be the chance to see some really amazing science and magic experiments Alice would never let you see if you went back to being yourself. It could be fun to be a part of some cool experiments if only for a little while. Your hand absentmindedly ran over the necklace and pocket watch as you thought about what to do.

Know what? With all these tools at your disposal, you could return to being John at any time you wanted. What was the rush? And with being an intern at a corporation that could literally transform people on a regular basis, you could literally be whoever or whatever you wanted. That was why you had been so fascinated with the laundry powder in the first place, right?

It's for that reason that you put the amulet away in your pocket and smile.

"Understood," you say. "My bad. You both just have a very...Motherly presence to you."

Sarah and Alice both share a look with each other. They both speak in perfect unison. "Well, if you must. We won't mind."

"...Okay, that's kind of creepy. Do you have to talk at the same time like that?"

"Apologies, we'll stop," said Alice. "Now, shall we proceed with the real procedure, Briana?"

"Right, removing my powers. Can you hold on a moment?"

You're about to get stuck at a certain size for an indefinite amount of time, so you figured it would be best to get yourself to a height where you can be considered normal and not a seven foot tall giant. You poke at yourself and bring your overall height down to a more reasonable height of 5'4. About average and still taller than both Sarah and Alice.

"Ready."

You were guided to the other chair in the room and strapped in like "Minnie" once was. With both Alice and Sarah working in tandem, the process goes much faster.

"Now, you might find this process a little tiring," said Alice as she placed what looked like a metal bowl over your head. "Just relax and it will be all over soon."

As soon as the cold metal touches your head, Sarah begins a countdown. You gripped the sides of the chair as electricity builds on your head.

You begin to feel very weak as the bowl heats up. Like all your strength is being sapped out of you or you're being shrunk, even though you remained the same size. You slumped further into the chair as the machine begin you dinged. Then came the sound of a pouring liquid.

"Eureka!" said Alice as she walked behind the machine. She returned with two vials filled with some colored water. One red and one green. "We've done it!"

You blink a few times. "What is that?"

"Your power in liquid form. We've manage to separate it into two. Drink the red and you'll acquire the shrinking powers. Drink the green and you'll acquire the growth ones. Now all that's left is to analyze each and study how to recreate it before our boss fires us."

"Well, that's...Neat."

"I'll get to work on this straight away," said Sarah, taking both vials from Alice. "You can get to work with Briana on the other experiment."

"Other experiment?" you asked. "What other experiment?"

"Well, if we're going to do more experiments than let me help out. Could someone get me out of this chair?" You ask, it looked like Alice had tied you down pretty well. Sarah shook her head though, "No need for that, we can run our next test with you sitting right there."

"Oh...does the Draining Chair have other features? Can it let me see into the future? Give me lazar vision? How about electric powers, it'd be cool to be able to shoot lightning out of my..."

"Don't be silly Briana," Alice said cutting you off, "You've seen that it is just a chair meant for draining powers. But what will it does to someone with I wonder. We must test this hypothesis and you are as usual the perfect test subject."

"Oh...ok. And you're sure that this isn't going to just electrocute me to death?"

Sarah said in a not very motherly way as she placed the red and green vials away for safe keeping and further testing. "You can do that?" You asked in surprise and Sarah hand waved this concern. "We'd bring you back in some capacity somehow." Although her words were...comforting, you still felt nervous as you felt some sparks hitting your zipper on your back. Alice stood by the light switch on the wall and asked, "Now you don't have any other major spells or artifacts effecting you right now, correct Briana. I need to know for the adjustments."

You thought about how you were technically still wearing Briana's body as a skin suit, but didn't think it best to bring that up now. "No mam."

"Excellent, let the test begin then." And before you could so much as ask for your last meal the switch was flicked and you felt electricity surge through you. You felt as though there was and electric vacuum sucking at your insides. Was it sucking out your guts? You're very soul? You only had a few seconds of thought before you blacked out wondering how the test results would play out.

The world went black for a moment before you were enveloped by a dim, white light. You felt cold and then warm again as the world came back to life around you. Though you couldn't blink. You couldn't breathe. You weren't even sure if you could speak as the lab returned to your field of vision.

"How odd," said Alice. "The machine clearly worked, but there doesn't appear to be any change to Briana."

You focused your vision on the big machine next to you. That's when you realized that you weren't sitting in the electric-looking chair anymore. You were trapped in a glass vial next to it.

It was then you realized that you didn't even have a body. You were just a disembodied consciousness on display with no way to make the others aware of your presence. You could only sit there and watch as Briana's body stirred.

"Well, she's alive at least," Sarah muttered under her breath as she went to inspect you.

"How do you feel, Briana?" asked Alice.

"...I feel weird," she blinked a few times, holding her head as she looked down. "Why am I so big?"

"Big? You're the same size you've always been, sweetie."

"Mommy? Why are there two of you?"

It fast became clear to you that it was Briana, the real one, who was back in control of her own body. Though she didn't appear to have a clue what was going on. That's right. Briana had been technically out cold while you parading around in her body. She wouldn't know everything that would have happened since you made her a suit in the doll house.

"Fascinating," muttered Sarah. "It appears the device is capable of draining memories."

"I concur with your theory," replied Alice. "We should continue with the testing then."

"You mean?"

"Yes," Alice said with a smirk. "What would happen if one were to consume Briana's memories? If it was you or I? Or would Briana gain her memories back? We should find out."

You felt yourself being lifted into the air as Sarah raised you up. You were going to be drunk like a bottle of soda, the only question was by whom?

As Sarah examined the contents of the vial she held that contained your soul or mind or whatever she said, "It should be one of us who consumes this. If Briana drinks it, then she may just return to her status quo and we have much to possibly learn from this infantile minded version of herself."

With Sarah out of the room, that left you access to the pocketwatch and the amulet at your disposal. You tried to ignore Briana's whimpering the corner. With the necklace, everything that had happened to her would just be forgotten anyway. No point in trying to comfort her, but it was hard to think with her shrill voice.

"Briana, I just need you to be quiet. Okay? Hush."

The first thing you needed to do was remove this place from the equation entirely though. The people in Witch HQ were nuts and your family couldn't be trusted working there. But having two moms would also be pretty weird too.

"Okay," you said, picking up the pocketwatch. "I got it."

You aimed the watch yourself, turned the hand backwards, and fired.

It felt like a blast of rejuvenation coming over you. Like taking a refreshing shower. Being in your mom's body, you were 40 years old. Or you had been. With the pocketwatch, the years were melting off you like wax of a candle.

Your face looked much more youthful with crow's feet faded away and wrinkles smoothed until they were nonexistent. You went from your 30's to your 20's and with that your body saw far less sagging. Underneath your labcoat, you could feel your breasts perk up. Then it slowed down when you dropped past 20 into your teens. You stopped when you were about 18 years old, bringing you back to Alice's original age. Mom short of looked like her in shape, but had red hair.

Briana sat strapped to the chair dumbfounded at your transformation.

"What...Why are you...What?"

"Don't worry," you said in a far less mature voice. "You don't remember this in T-minus...Now."

You slipped on the amulet and altered everything so that the situation was far more in your favor.

You were Alice Wallace, daughter of Sarah Wallace, whom you nearly looked identical to. You had a dog, Lucky. And you had an older sister in college, Briana. You came from a very bookish family, being smart enough to get an internship at a local corporation in your field of study. Briana was also smarter than Janet, so she'd be less bitchy to you as an older sister.

"There," you said with a smirk. "How do you feel, Briana?"

Briana blinked a few times.

"What do you mean, sis? With the experiment? I don't feel much different. What was this chair supposed to do?"

You smiled at your success.

"Well," you said, tucking the pocket watch away and moving to unstrap Briana from the chair. "That solves that then. Oh, well on the chair. Guess we'll just come back tomorrow and try something else. Where's, uh, mom, Briana?"

"Don't you remember? She said she was going to the bathroom."

You awoke with a start from a strange dream. It had started as a normal sort of thing with some sort of school scenario, before taking a turn into the weird. Something involving you inflating like a putty-filled balloon.

Groggily shaking your head, something about the motion made you pause. Your hair felt longer and tugged a bit at your scalp. Running your hand through it, you couldn't help but notice how soft it was now. Nothing like you were used to.

A bit apprehensive, and still a bit out of it in a way only a midday nap can cause, you stumble over to the door length mirror in your room. It was all you could do to avoid yelping at the sight in your mirror.

Your hair was definitely longer, hanging nearly down to your ears, and almost seemed to have acquired a reddish hue. Not only that, but your entire body seemed shaped... differently. If you were more perceptive, you might have been able to tell this was due to a slight accumulation of fat on your hips and thighs, giving you a distinctly androgynous or even feminine figure. You even might be shorter!

With a jolt at taking all this in, you snap out of your remaining stupor. The wash!! Somehow you were changing, but - you did a quick examination of yourself - you weren't wearing any clothes you had washed recently. Maybe touching the soap earlier had something to do with it?

You turned to the side, getting an impressive profile of your new burgeoning butt. For some reason, this sent your face into a bit of a flush. Maybe this wasn't so bad? But if you're not wearing any washed clothes at the moment, how would the wash continue to affect you?

You weighed your options a bit. On the one hand, you had another two-ish hours before your family came home, and could see where this takes you. You tentatively touch the softer skin of your upper thigh. I mean, this could be a once in a lifetime opportunity right?

On the other hand though, even if you could somehow convince your family to leave you be in your room (unlikely), how would you then deal with this when school comes around?

This couldn't be right. You had to be much more ill than you realized or maybe your imagination was playing tricks on you. "No, this isn't right." You say to yourself as you walk up closer to the mirror to confirm the impossible. What was looking back at you was yourself but you were...off. You arms and legs especially were dramatically off and the rest of your body seemed to be slowly following. You still had the had off the normal teenage John Wallace but that seemed to be all that was normal. You were definitely a couple of inches shorter than you knew you were. Your shirt seemed to be now too big for you with your child like arms and upper body and your lower body, while shorter, was much larger in thickness from the waist down.

"What the heck going on!" You shout out. Feeling a need to look at everything you ran to your bathroom and ripped off your shirt and the gloves to confirm what the other mirror already told you. "I look like I have the arms and chest of a kid!" And you followed that up by taking off your pants and socks and looking in horror at the thickness that wasn't there before. "This is wrong! This can't be me! What' going on, those aren't my legs! Those aren't my feet!...Wait...they really aren't my feet." You bent down and looked closely at your toes and recognized the polish on the nails. "That's moms favorite nail polish. Are these...her feet?" It took a few minutes of thinking things out in your head and connecting the insane magical dots but you got there eventually. You put the thoughts together out loud, "Mom's socks made me have her legs, and those were Briana's gloves so I have her arms and upper chest...so that should mean..."

You sprint to the laundry room just as your clothes finish drying. You dig through the hot clean cloths and find a pair of matching socks (you're not an animal after all) and put them on. Now that you were paying close attention you felt and saw the magic slowly work. Your feet grew back to their previous size and you could feel the magic slowly start to work it's way up your legs. "Now the arms." You said as you sprint to your room and after a few minutes of digging you found your Christmas gloves and happily put them on your tiny hands and...nothing.

"Why isn't it working?" You said frustrated at the magic not working, then like a lightning bolt your brain reminded you of something you thought was odd. "The new detergent was called Witch Wash. That's where this magic weirdness is coming from!" So you grab the gloves and put them in the wash on their own and set the washer to it's quickest setting. It took what felt like forever but the washer and then the dryer finished with the gloves and you put them on. Slowly, your hands began to turn back. And just in time too because at that moment you heard the door open as your mom cried out, "John! We're home! Help unload the car please."

"Sure thing mom!" You said looking at yourself again. Your legs were about half way to being back to normal and your arms had barely started turning back. There was pretty much no way you could hide your changes the way you looked now. You looked around for some miracle solution and then saw the clean clothes pile and notice Janet's house robe. It was big enough that it could hide the current changes although if you wore it too long you'd have more changes to deal with trying to fix. Then again you could just tell your sisters and mom the truth...that idea's so crazy it just might work.

No way were you letting your family in on such a cool secret. At least until you'd flushed it out and had your own fun without your family meddling in any way. As a smile spreads across your face your mom voice calls out again, "John! A little help with the car would be appreciated." "Yeah, get your butt out here!" Janet followed up. With your final decision made you grab Janet's house robe which was big and thick enough to cover your still kinda chubby legs and scrawny arms from view. "Feeling sick." You said trying to make your voice as low and gravelly as possible. "Going to bed."

"Well, all right, I'll be up to take your temperature and give you a nice soup."

"Thanks." You quickly say as you scream internally that you had actually managed to hide your changes. Once you got back in your room you throw Janet's robe on the ground and put on some of your freshly laundered pajamas and jumped into bed. In the last hour you'd discovered magic detergent that made clothes magic, figured out how to use it, managed to hide it from your family, and even got your mom to make you your favorite soup that she'd serve you in bed. Taking a deep breath you weakly knock on the door. You knock for a minute straight before the door finally opens and you breath a sigh of relief. Before you was Jenny, a girl you'd known since elementary school. You'd been friends since then but never had gone out with her even though you really wanted to. Jenny was 6' feet tall (and felt much taller now) with brown hair and a smaller modest chest (not that you looked at it >_>). At the moment she had her hair held back with a sweat band and had on workout clothes. And so the girl with a smile that would always brighten your day looked at you with surprise. But she quickly recovered, "Isn't it a little early for Halloween you cute little...thing. You." Apparently Jenny couldn't tell if you were a boy or a girl, now that you thought of it you weren't 100% sure of your gender yourself.

Not wanting to drop the big truth bomb right away you decide to just try and get in the door, "I need your help, may I please come inside?"

Jenny looked surprise but her kind heart took over, "Of coarse, come in, do you need me to call your mommy?"

As soon as you waddled your way in and Jenny shut the door you said, "That is the last person I want you to call. Now Jenny I know this is going to sound insane, but it's me. John."

Jenny looked confused and understandably so, but after you spent 15 minutes describing in detail big events in your friendship from the first day you met to when she moved next door to you to what you guys said in class at the end of the school year. It was a lot to take in but Jenny seemed to not think you were a crazy person.

"Okay, let's say I believe you, and oddly enough I think I do John. How did you get like this."

"I think I'd better show you. Can you please unzip my pumpkin Jenny?"

Sure enough what you already knew was now public, the magic in the pumpkin costume had magically made your flesh fill out the whole thing, including some ridges on the sides of you. Before Jenny could have a full on panic attack you explained to her the magic laundry detergent and how you were experimenting and how you didn't want your family to see you like this. As you explained a thought occurred in the back of your mind to you to check your current gender, but you couldn't really look down over your roundness to check, and you couldn't move your arms to check yourself. And you sure as heck weren't going to ask Jenny to check for you so you leave that thought to the side.

"But why come to me?"

"Well," You say as you blush a little, "I trust you the most."

Jenny blushed a bit too after you said that, "Okay, what do you need me to do for you."

"Go to my house, the door is unlocked and my family won't be back for a while. In the laundry room by the powder is a basket of my dry clothes, bring me some that I can wear so I can change back."

“What’s going on over there?” You stopped in midair over the business section of your town.

While no means small, your hometown was far from the biggest city in your state. It was large enough that even a thousand people gathered somewhere wouldn’t cause much of a disturbance. But around the Hotel Indigo, the largest hotel in the city, was a particularly large cluster of people. Large enough to put traffic into gridlock.

With dinner not being for a little while longer, you decided to drop in attitude to investigate. Landing out of sight on a nearby rooftop, boobs bouncing in place as you touched down, you saw exactly what had the city abuzz.

“Of course, Waifu Con!”

An annual tradition among the nerds, Waifu Con was the celebration of all things anime, comics, and games. Naturally, as the name implied, the primary feature of the consortium of geeks was the focus on women, particularly of the large breasted variety.

“I’d fit right in, like this,” you said to yourself, looking down at your perfectly toned body. “Can’t hurt to check it out, I suppose.”

With your mind made up, you jumped down into the alleyway and blended into the crowds as best as you could to make your way to the hotel entrance. Blending in was easier said than done with you being 6’6 and bigger than anyone around you. Even people typically on the tall side when you had been a guy now looked tiny to you and all you could see was a sea of heads.

It wasn’t all bad, as many people gave you a wide berth being a giantess. Those that didn’t went up to you with compliments on such a realistic cosplay. Most of the men stole stares at your chests, which some people even whispering to each other than your breasts were obviously fake. The comments made you blush and you continued waiting in line with your arms crossed over your boobs.

Another sign caught your attention. “Cosplayer entrance?”

It sounded a lot better than waiting in a long line that seemingly went nowhere, and would spare you from the stares. You pushed on through and soon found yourself in one of the lower levels of the hotel.

There were far less people around, though you noted that all of them were in costumes of sorts. Many were attractive women who gave angry glares at you as you passed. You suddenly felt very unwelcomed being 6’6 goddess, essentially. You didn’t even think you were wearing makeup and you still put all of them to shame in the looks department. That wasn’t even mentioning your chest sizes. You had them all beat by a landslide.

“Maybe this was a mistake,” you decided, realizing that attending a con would just mean a bunch of unwanted attention.

You started to turn around and noticed a new line forming solely of various cosplayers approaching what appeared to be a series of veiled booths. A sign plastered out front explained what all the fuss was about.

“Costume Swap?” you read aloud. “Spread the love of your costume with various cosplayers and trade in your costume in return for a new outfit for yourself! Then join in with our costume march.”

You recalled this event in previous years. It basically involved cosplayers trading their outfits for a little bit of silliness, with other outfits brought in by the staff. “Alice?”, the voice rang out from downstairs.

“Answer them!”, Alice hissed, keeping her voice low, “We don’t have time to switch back without them noticing, so we’ll have to pretend to be each other.”

You nodded even as you could feel perspiration setting in on your forehead.

“I’m upstairs, I’ll be right down.” You started to button up the shirt Alice had handed you before tugging up the jeans. As you went to leave she grabbed you by the arm.

“Hold on! You forgot these.” She slid the glasses on your face and suddenly everything snapped into clarity. You hadn’t even noticed your poor eyesight was until just now.

Taking a deep breath, you stepped out of the room and into the unknown. You summoned what you knew of Alice; Her reserved nature, her calm, her sense of ease and put it to the forefront of your mind. All I have to do is pretend.

“Hi mom, hi dad,” you said as you turned the corner into the living room. Alice’s dad was a sizable man, as tall as you normally were, with broad shoulders and thickly built. He had an impeccably sculpted head of hair and a strong mustache. Alice’s mom was every inch the statuesque beauty you recalled. Tall for a woman, (though still well shorter than your regular body) with a beautiful mane of chestnut brown hair that fell down her back. She had Alice’s inherent good looks, but ones that were more refined, more mature. Some of it owed to age and some of it belonged to a keen makeup brush. Like Alice, she was pear-shaped with most of her weight settling in her hips and rear, though she did possess a noticeably larger bust than her daughter. And while not quite as round as her daughter, there was no denying her status as a plus-sized woman. She was breathtaking.

“How was your afternoon?”, you managed to squeak out, attempting to keep the conversation light.

“Oh it was fine,” said Alice’s mother, barely even looking up from the recipe card she held in her hand, evidently plucked from a Rolodex on her kitchen island. “You know the Johnsons; They always seem a few minutes away from an all-out fight. Ben can’t stand Lisa and Lisa can’t help but criticize Ben.” She sighed. “But they’ve been our friends forever, so I guess we’ll endure it.”

“Alice, whose bike is that out front?”, Alice’s father hadn’t even looked over the paper he was reading at kitchen table. His voice was strong, but not exactly cold as it flecked with warmness when he said his daughter’s name. He was talking about your bicycle.

“Oh, that would be John Wallace’s bicycle.”

“John Wallace? Sarah Wallace’s son?”, asked your mother. “Is he here right now? Why hasn’t he said hello? And why is he here?” She gave you a questioning look that you recognized from your own mother. Mom’s must learn that one in school, you thought.

“We have a lab report for Chemistry that we’re working on. I should have told you he was coming by, I apologize.” You attempted to use a formal tone that you thought suited Alice.

“Don’t worry about it honey, but please let us know in the future. I’d hate for the place to be a mess when someone comes by.”

“Why don’t you go and get him?”, your father suggested.

You nodded and headed back up the stairs. Alice was at your desk with her chemistry book open. She had evidently prepared for her parents coming upstairs to greet their guest.

“They want to meet me? Alright. That’s easy enough.” She paused, looking for something. “Oh yes. Your phone has been buzzing quite a lot the last few minutes. I believe it’s your mother.”

You checked the texts and it was indeed your mother. She had been called into work and needed you to come and watch your sister. Great. As if things couldn’t get any worse.

You frowned for a second, trying to think. What to do? What to do?

The stupid washer-dryer stack that your mom just had to get: it sucks.

Being five foot goddamn three: major suckage.

Carrying around what felt like fifteen pounds of flesh packed into all the wrong places: you don’t even need to say it.

Inchoate feelings of sympathy for busty women are stirring in your heart. Your unwanted boobs are proving to be much more of a liability than you had imagined; the few futile hops you made towards the detergent sent you scrabbling for the edges of your robe, to prevent your chest from staging a grand escape. Thankfully, your robes did let you cover up to stifle the bouncing; but, of course, they snapped back to their original cleavage-baring-crevasse the instant you weren’t in danger of a nip-slip.

Whatever. It’s not like you were expecting a gift basket from the goddamn thing.

Now you’re on stepladder-search-duty, and walking around is no less frustrating. Either you take stupidly small steps that rock your liberty-bell hips like a pendulum, all the while brushing soft thighs against the aptly appellated — and thankfully untouched — ‘Lil John; or you could clomp around with your knees bent at near-right angles which does make you feel like a big strong man, save for the fact that your chest’s movement could probably be registered on the Richter scale.

It’s a Morton’s Fork, but you choose the latter as the less-forky option. Clomping is a difficult task to accomplish with bare feet, but you manage a convincing facsimile with your bare feet. A slapping echo follows you as you inquisitively stomp yourself around the washing-dryer-stack, the water heater; everything that was illuminated by the guttering stair light.

Nothing. No stepladder, no plywood scaffolding, no stilts: not a hint of any elevation-tool, save for a dusty pingpong table that makes your muscles ache at the mere thought of moving it. Your only option is to venture into the Abyss, the cobweb-coated shadows that carpeted eighty percent of your basement.

But before that, a breather. You hop up onto the side of the table-tennis-table that faces the dark and try to quash the small amount of offense you feel at its groan. Your body wasn’t really built for stomping around; but then again, what body was? A plurality of answers readily streams into your mind, a veritable list of action heroes, grizzled and male every one.

You frown into the dark. Tina just had to pick the big-tiddied shorty for her foray into cosplay. And you just had to try it on. And what was it with this ‘Witch Wash’? You’d scoff at the idea of magic detergent two hours ago, but growing tits seemed an equally improbably eventuality. Shit, what could you even do with it? Eat it, in some mad attempt to return to normal?

You slump backward onto the cold wood, momentarily spluttering when your beefers threaten to smother you. Your strangulation avoided, you cast a forlorn gaze at your left hand, flexing your fingers experimentally. You’re certainly not a bodybuilder, but watching the slight striations of muscle shift is a welcome sight from the suffocating softness of, well, everything else. Well, almost everything else. You trace your jawline with a finger, appreciating the burgeoning stubble. It’s one of those ‘don’t know what you got ‘till it’s gone’ things, and it fucking sucks.

No! You surge to a seated position and grit your teeth. You’re not out just yet! You hop to the floor and wobble into the shadows, your pace shifting to a much more careful one. Eating asphalt seems a major roadblock on a return to normality.

Guided by muscle memory, you tiptoe through the blackness. The architecture of your basement seems to be designed to frustrate navigation rather than facilitate it, but if you’ve taken the right steps — and you’re fairly certain that you have — a lightbulb’s pull chain should be right above you…

But your fingers swipe through open air.

A frown bends your mouth. It had to be here. Four steps to the right and twelve forward.
You wave your hand above your head once again. Nothing.
Little hops are employed to no avail.

Gritting your teeth, you tense all remaining muscles left in your legs. In a fantastic yet unseen display, you leap up, clasping a thin string of metal beads at the zenith of your jump, pulling it down with you.

Unfortunately, you are nowhere near acquainted enough with your mostly-new body to transition your feat into anything resembling a smooth landing, leaving you to collapse into a tangle of limbs and bouncy bits as the lightbulb gutters to life.

Rubbing your sore rear, you glare balefully at the lightbulb. Stupid thing. It’s nowhere near high enough to justify such athletics from a normal person, but you suppose that around seventy percent of you isn’t ‘normal’ anymore.

You squint at the chain backlit by the alleged lightbulb. Sure it was a bit high up, but your arm should still be —

A small pop comes from your left, and your blood runs cold as your robe flutters.

You whip your hand in front of your face, only to witness smooth white skin spread across it like spilled milk, overwriting any of the patchily tanned muscles that once occupied their space.

“No!” you squeal more loudly than you intended. “You’re cheating! I’m supposed to feel it!”

Unintentional double-entendres fly over your head as your urgency spikes. You bring your right hand to cinch around your left to do something, but your blood runs cold as you view the limb. It’s the ‘after’ to your left’s ‘mid-before’; a smooth tube of flesh packed with just enough muscle to prevent the whole thing from developing into cellulite-cylinders. You wiggle your fingers just to see delicate ones obey your command, the nails lightly manicured with a glossy red coating.

Your robes, meanwhile, seem to have picked up on your frustration and shiver yet again. At once, your left arm is inundated with pleasant sensation, as if it was being caressed by downy feathers. This does nothing to displace your sour expression.

As quickly as it started, it stops. Your sleeves relax — you didn’t even notice that they were tight!

Your newly dantified hands throw everything into sharp relief. A small optimistic voice in your head had been insisting that your boobs just looked big, but their contrast to your arms throw them into sharp relief. If those monsters weren’t restrained by your robes, you probably couldn’t even manage a handbra!

You grind your teeth in frustration. Goddammit, they aren’t your robes!

Erroneous thought corrected, you stalk around the semi-illuminated basement to continue your stepladder-quest.

With illumination in the basement, you could now see your situation and how fucked up it was. Granted, you supposed there were worse things that could be happening to you than slowly being morphed into a hot chick by a pair of sentient clothes. It could be one of those painful metamorphosis' complete with the bones snapping and plastic animatronics that looked real only if you didn't shine a light directly on them. A quick squeeze with your new smaller hands which made your already impressive bust seem even bigger was all the confirmation you needed that this was really happening to you.

As if offended by your actions, suddenly the menace that was the green robe began to flutter around and pull itself off your shoulders. You arced your slimmer arms back as the jacket flapped off of you and flew back towards the washing machine, looking more like a great bat than clothes.

"Where the hell does it think it's going?" you asked, not really wanting to know the answer.

At least the brief break from the robe's influence allowed you a moment of freedom. Exposed, you could see just how form fitting the blouse and the tight pants had become on you. You were sporting a distinctly female shape, and a very exaggerated one at that. It didn't help matters you had also dropped nearly an entire foot in height, with the reach in your arms now disappearing as well. Besides your face, your hair, your feet, and the noticeable bulge in your tight pants, you were completely someone else. A foreign body that was not your own and had its own balance problems being so top heavy. You dreaded to think what it might be like to walk in high heels like this.

Thankfully, a little bit of luck was on your side.

As you searched around the dark depths for your penultimate goal which would lead you to discovering what the heck Witch Wash had to do with your strange appearance, your eyes laid on a flash of silver and red under the beams. The stepladder! Bringing you one step closer to getting to the bottom of this, pun intended. Though the object was quite bulky for someone of your stunted size, you couldn't help but notice the ladder didn't feel nearly as heavy in your arms. How odd.

Almost as odd as the sound you heard coming from the way back to the washer. Clip clop. Clip clop.

"Oh, no..."


The sight of the green jacket carrying two black high heeled sandals along the ground like it was walking upside down should not have triggered any familiar sensations you had come to associate from horror movies. In fact, to anyone else the image should have been portrayed as comical, but they weren't the ones getting molded into an anime character. Seeing the two shoes, you knew damn well what the jacket intended and you made a beeline for the washer. You weren't allowed to get far as the jacket wrapped around your ankle, sending you tumbling to the floor. The ladder in hand bounced noisily out of your reach. The only thing that saved you from a mouthful of broken teeth was the pillow of tit you landed on.

"Oh, come on," you complained. "It's hard enough to walk like this!"

The jacket ignored your protests, grappling you by your leg like a wrestler. Its sleeve wrapped tighter around your right foot first, pulling and squeezing as you watched your foot shrink in size and ignoring the fact that it felt almost like a massage. You were given a moment to wiggle your new toes and compare foot sizes to your untouched left one. If you were once a men's 12, you had dropped to a men's 4. Such tiny and dainty feet matched your new body perfectly and it was only the beginning as the jacket wrapped tighter on your left foot.

While it seemed more content to focus on your transformation, you could make a grab for the ladder which was just out of range. You kept trying to put out from your mind how good this was starting to feel as there became less and less of you until John Wallace would disappear from the earth completely. You did pay attention when the jacket reached for the first shoe though. It was a perfect fit right out of Citronella, only you didn't want to marry no Prince from the ball after this was all said and done. You held your breath and cursed your own shorter arms as your fingers grazed against the ladder. The other shoe was getting placed on your other foot. You didn't want to wait and see what the jacket would go for next of your dwindling identity.

Where it came from and what happens afterwards is a decision totally up to you!
